data.title: We Had To Fire A 58-Year-Old Business Partner. Here’s What Happened
data.meta_description: He had been working in business longer than I had been alive. But rather than learning, it had been more than seven months of daily struggle. He spent months speaking to clients, trying to offer them…
data.text:
I started with high hopes of learning from him.

He had been working in business longer than I had been alive. But rather than learning, it had been more than seven months of daily struggle.

This business partner had been underperforming for consecutive quarters.

No revenue generation.

Poor quality project delivery.

Clients that complained about his work.

Eventually, we had to get rid of him.

Here’s what I learned about people and business.

#1: He couldn’t adapt to a changing business environment.

Artificial intelligence destroyed his business portfolio.

And he couldn’t adapt.

He spent months speaking to clients, trying to offer them the same service, but no one was interested. People realized they could use ChatGPT for their bid and tender responses.

Bid and tender businesses are now completely reliant on AI.

But rather than embrace AI, he denied reality.

He believed that his manual and labor-intensive service was superior and that clients would continue to return…
